results.title: Dancing on the Ceiling
results.brief_description: Before Lionel Ritchie’s hit single from his third album became most recognisable for being. staple of 80s club nights, Dancing on the Ceiling swaggered its way to world domination, charting in countries around the world.

constellations_other.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

results.title: Dancing in the street: a rock and roll history
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Hugh Thompson, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description: An outstanding documentary series examining the history of rock and roll which contains in-depth interviews with pivotal figures in rock and roll history and rare footage of performances by legendary artists. The research and in-depth analysis make this worth watching.

results.title: Dancing in the moonlight
results.creator_credit: Ned Lander, Trevor Graham, Sharon Connolly, Townsville Aboriginal & Islander Media Association and Yarra Bank Films
results.brief_description: Dancing in the Moonlight tells the story of the Fifth Festival of Pacific Arts held in Townsville in August 1988. Amid celebration and performance, indigenous Pacific peoples shared and debated ideas and and concerns which inform life in the region today. Many South Pacific peoples are struggling to achieve the right to self-determination, to reclaim lands lost to the colonisers, fisheries invaded by big business and peaceful societies threatened by superpower deployment of nuclear weapons throughout their ocean. “Dancing in the Moonlight” is testament to their struggle to maintain their own languages and culture in the face of political, economic and cultural imperialism.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ned Lander, Trevor Graham, Sharon Connolly, Townsville Aboriginal & Islander Media Association and Yarra Bank Films

results.title: Dancing again
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Hannan Kuea
results.brief_description: Hannan Kuea reminisces about her childhood and life in Sudan and especially her wedding day - this very special day to be the last of the families getting together in Sudan before the married couple move on to Kenya and finally to Australia. On this wedding day the families (one side from North Sudan, the other from South Sudan) danced their traditional tribal dances in celebration. It would be many years later before the families reunite to dance once again in their new land on the other side of the world.

results.title: Dances with wolves [Portuguese subtitles]
results.creator_credit: Kevin Costner, Jim Wilson, Majestic Films International and TIG Productions
results.brief_description: Assigned to an abandoned army post, Civil War hero John Dunbar (Kevin Costner), finds himself alone and beyond civilisation. Only a wolf and some roving Sioux Indians provide distractions. Curiosity and survival force Dunbar to overcome his fear and he develops a unique relationship with the Sioux. But as the US military ruthlessly pushes west, the Indians’ existence is threatened and Dunbar finds himself torn between two cultures. Honoured with seven Academy Awards including Best Picture (1991), this epic is a cinematic masterpiece of scope, beauty, spirituality and rousing adventure. Dean Semler’s photography is breathtaking. Screenplay by Michael Blake, based on his novel. In English with Portugese subtitles.

results.title: Dancers of the sea
results.creator_credit: Genevieve Hamon, Jean Painleve and Les Documents Cinematographiques
results.brief_description: Made by Painleve, famous French scientific documentary filmmaker, this film is a close study of a number of types of starfish. It deals with eating methods, breeding habits, movement on the ocean floor and in the water of some beautiful sea creatures. The film uses high speed and microcinematography to great advantage in this study of marine life.

results.title: Dancers
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Yoram Globus, Menahem Golan, Baryshnikov Productions, Hera Productions and Golan-Globus
results.brief_description: Mikhail Baryshnikov, one of the world’s greatest and most admired ballet dancers stars in this romantic drama about an American ballet company’s arrival in Italy to perform the romantic ballet ‘Giselle’. Baryshnikov plays Tony (Anton) Sergeyev, lead dancer and director of the production, ladies’ man, experienced and charming who finds himself attracted to the newest member of his troupe, the young and naive American teenager Lisa (Julie Kent). Art begins to mirror life as the drama of love and betrayal of ‘Giselle’ is played out backstage between Tony and Lisa. Features the dancers of the American Ballet Theater, Allesandra Ferri (Francesca), Leslie Browne (Nadine) and Mariangela Melato (the Contessa). ‘Giselle’ is conducted by Michael Tilson Thomas and performed by the London Symphony Orchestra, original music by Pino Donaggio.
